questions.skill: Correctly punctuate to avoid run-on sentences and fragments
questions.question:
The museum's new exhibit on ancient Egypt has attracted visitors from around the world _______ historians and archaeologists have praised its accuracy and educational value.

Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?
questions.explanation: Two independent clauses need proper punctuation. A semicolon correctly joins them when followed by a transitional word. A comma before 'both' creates a comma splice. 'Both' alone creates a run-on. A colon is used to introduce a list or explanation, not to join independent clauses of equal weight.
